meanings.definition: The act of allocating a portion of something to a smaller division or category.
meanings.sent1: The suballocations of funds to different departments were carefully planned.
meanings.sent2: Each team was responsible for managing their own suballocations of resources.
meanings.sent3: The suballocations of snacks at the party caused a mini feeding frenzy.
meanings.sent4: Her suballocations of time were like pieces of a puzzle fitting perfectly together.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the concept of suballocations using colorful blocks for better understanding.

meanings.definition: A specific portion or division of something that has been allocated to a smaller group or category.
meanings.sent1: The suballocations of tasks among the team members were fair and balanced.
meanings.sent2: Each student received their own suballocations of classroom supplies.
meanings.sent3: The suballocations of toppings on the pizza made each slice unique.
meanings.sent4: His suballocations of responsibilities made the project run smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The suballocations of toys in the playroom kept everything organized and tidy.
